metadata.description: Synthetic FitRep cases for benchmark evaluation - for quick Testing, tier neutral accomplishments

cases.name: Delgado
accomplishments: Managed the receipt, storage, and distribution of Class I through Class IX supplies for a 300-Marine battalion during garrison and field operations.
Coordinated the ground transportation of 45 vehicles and associated equipment to and from the deployment for training exercise at Fort Stewart.
Processed 320 supply requests through the Global Combat Support System, maintaining a 96 percent fill rate for the reporting period.
Supervised five Marines in the logistics section, conducting weekly inventory reconciliation of all accountable equipment.
Planned and executed the battalion's annual field supply economy exercise, accounting for all organizational property across four companies.
Tracked and reported the maintenance status of 38 principal end items, coordinating with the maintenance section to reduce deadline equipment by four vehicles.

cases.name: Hawkins
accomplishments: Managed the receipt, storage, and issue of ammunition for a regiment of 1,200 Marines across four subordinate battalions.
Supervised 10 Marines in the ammunition section, maintaining compliance with explosive safety regulations across three ammunition supply points.
Planned and executed ammunition support for 30 live fire training events, issuing over 500,000 rounds of small arms and ordnance during the reporting period.
Conducted quarterly explosive safety inspections of all storage facilities, identifying and correcting 18 discrepancies.
Coordinated the turn-in and redistribution of excess ammunition across the regiment, reducing the excess ammunition inventory.
Maintained ammunition transaction records and submitted monthly expenditure reports to the division ammunition officer.
Trained 25 Marines from subordinate units on ammunition handling procedures and explosive safety requirements.
